intro: Lepidagathis aparine, commonly known as the stinging leaf or sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. The plant produces tiny, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Lepidagathis aparine is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
